name: Spanish Words in Letters Quiz | Spanish | 10 Questions

questions.text: How would you write a word that means "that" in one letter?
questions.explanation:
s&k.

	"S" is pronounced as "ese," which means "that."

questions.text: How would you write a word that means "Hew!"("Cut with an axe!") in one letter?
questions.explanation:
H.

	To cut with an axe is "hachar." The command form is "hache," pronounced the same as the letter H.

questions.text: How would you write a word that means "bird" in two letters?
questions.explanation:
AV&AB.

	AV is pronounced "ave," which means "bird."

questions.text: How would you write a word that is a command to "Kiss!" in two letters?
questions.explanation:
BC.

	BC is pronounced "bese," which is the command form of "besar"- to kiss.

questions.text: How would you write a word that means "I made" or "I did" in two letters?
questions.explanation:
IC.

	IC is pronounced the same as "hice," which means "I did."

questions.text: How would you write a word that is the name of a Mexican border city, famous for its beer breweries, in three letters?
questions.explanation:
TKT.

	TKT is pronounced as "Tecate," which is the name of the city.

questions.text: How would you write a word that is a command to "See!" in two letters?
questions.explanation:
VA&BA.

	VA is pronounced "vea," which means "you see."

questions.text: How would you write a word that means "baby" in two letters?
questions.explanation:
BB.

	BB is pronounced "bebe," which means "baby."

questions.text: How would you write a word that means "must" in two letters?
questions.explanation:
DB.

	DB is pronounced "debe," which means "must."

questions.text: How would you write a word that means "freckle" in two letters?
questions.explanation:
PK.

	PK is pronounced "peca," which means "freckle."
